grains.name: Turkey Red
grains.bakingCharacteristics: Performs well in bread, pizza dough, crackers, cookies, pie crusts, muffins, and biscuits. Truly is an all-purpose whole wheat.
grains.history: It was brought from Crimea to Kansas by Mennonite farmers in the 1870's.

grains.name: Red Fife
grains.bakingCharacteristics: Performs well in bread, pizza dough, crackers, cookies, pie crusts, muffins, and biscuits. Truly is an all-purpose whole wheat.
grains.history: It first came to the U.S. from Canada in the mid 1800’s.

grains.name: Rouge De Bordeaux
grains.flavor: Rich nutty and sweet flavor with notes of cinnamon
grains.bakingCharacteristics: Performs well in bread, pizza dough, bagels, crackers, muffins, and biscuits.
grains.history: It was originally brought to France by the Romans sometime before Christ and then became a staple flour in the 1900’s.
